reviews.review:
Un excelente FPS y un shoter que a pesar de tener los graficos algo envejecidos facilmente supera a muchos de los que salen hoy dia, historia contanda en tiempo real dandodete la posibilidad de si quieres o de como quieres oirla, buenos puzzles, buena progresion conforme avanzamos, buen sistema de armas, entretenidos segmentos de conduccion.
la unica queja real que tengo son las pantallas de carga pero aparte de eso, ES UNO DE LOS MEJORES JUEGOS QUE SE HAN HECHO! y me apena no haberlo jugado antes

El mejor juego de la historia mundial!!! Valve si no sacas la 3ra parte nunca vas a volver a tener el mejor juego del mundo por mas ofertas que hagas!

what can be said of Half-Life 2 that hasnt been said yet?

many people to this day still greatly praise this game, and neckbeards abound await the holy day of Half-Life 3 as if it were the second coming. 

if youve somehow managed to not play this game then heres an honest review. your welcome

WHAT YOULL BE DOING:

1. shooting things
2. running
3. listening to people talk while you never say anything ever
4. shooting more things
5. crowbar
6. crowbar
7. crabs
8. gravity gun
9. still listening and never EVER saying anything EVER

all in all its a good game. worth a playthrough once i suppose. maybe your mind will be blown.

its nothing special but not terrible

[h1] Un cl√°sico que no te LAMBDA con queso [/h1]

‚ÄúHalf Life 2 es muy bueno, Half life 2 es un cl√°sico, Half life 2 es un juego al que tienes que jugar antes de morir, para cu√°ndo Half Life 3‚Ä¶‚Äù
 
Es dif√≠cil acceder a Half Life 2 y no tener todos estos mensajes en la cabeza. La sombra que proyecta este t√≠tulo es tan extensa que hacer una valoraci√≥n del mismo intentando ser objetivo me parece imposible e impensable. Por ello, creo que la mejor forma de contribuir en la rese√±a y guiar en la decisi√≥n de ‚Äú¬øme lo compro o no?‚Äù es contar cual ha sido mi experiencia con el juego.

Llego a Half Life 2 oblig√°ndome a mi mismo a jugarlo y sin saber NADA m√°s all√° de que te van a dar una palanca en alg√∫n momento. No soy fan de los shooters en primera persona y ten√≠a pavor de pasarme 10 horas jugando a un juego idolatrado por la comunidad y encontrarlo envejecido y pesado al no poder verlo desde las gafas de la nostalgia.

Nada m√°s lejos. Desde que empieza el juego se aprecia el nivel de detalle obsesivo con el que est√°n dise√±ados los escenarios. El dise√±o de niveles es EXCELENTE: siempre tienes la sensaci√≥n de estar en un sitio real, que existe, y no en un nivel de videojuego. Te encontrar√°s con muchas partes a lo largo de la aventura que recordar√°s durante mucho tiempo porque realmente te hacen sentir totalmente dentro del universo del t√≠tulo.

Sin embargo, como seguramente sepas, lo mas car√°cteristico y celebrado de HL2 es la forma en la que cuenta su historia. Es maravilloso ver como abraza el medio del videojuego prescindiendo por completo de cinem√°ticas y dejando que seas t√∫, como jugador, el que decidas a donde mirar para ver lo que est√° pasando. Considero este juego como un aut√©ntico modelo a seguir para la industria del videojuego y que, lamentablemente, creo que no ha influido lo suficiente en este aspecto.

Adem√°s, el ritmo del juego es un in-crescendo constante. Se pasa de unos primeros cap√≠tulos mas pausados hasta un final fren√©tico y lleno de acci√≥n. El juego se queda en un punto tan alto que sin duda deja con ganas de m√°s.

[b] ¬øY en lo jugable? [/b] No me quiero extender mucho en este punto porque no soy jugador de fps pero creo que es divertido. Apuntas y disparas, o sea que correcto. Tiene algunos puzles (menos de los que me gustar√≠a A MI) que me parecen ingeniosos y divertidos ya que te sirves de la f√≠sica de los objetos para resolverlos.

En lo negativo, o quiz√° menos destacable, he encontrado un argumento m√°s bien pasable y que cumple como excusa para seguir avanzando, pero lleno de personajes olvidables y poco carism√°ticos, incluyendo al protagonista y al antagonista. Por otra parte, el doblaje al castellano, que si bien es muy gracioso, es mal√≠simo y te saca por completo de la historia.

CONCLUSI√ìN: 
[b] ¬øEs una compra obligada? [/b] No.

[b] ¬øEs una compra segura? [/b] Sin duda lo es, y creo que si alguien como yo se ha dejado enamorar por este juego cualquiera puede. Es uno de los juegos mas ic√≥nicos de la historia del medio y merece mucho la pena descubrir por qu√©. Adem√°s, est√° muy bien remasterizado.
 
[b] ¬øVale los 8,20 que cuesta sin rebaja? [/b] Yo creo que s√≠, pero a no ser que mi rese√±a te haya dejado con los dientes muy largos creo que agradecer√°s esperar una rebajita (y suelen rebajarlo mucho).
Un juego muy muy bueno me encanto la trama y los personajes son muy buenos los enemigos son geniales,lo recomiendo.       (Ya saqueen el half life 3) :c

Half-Life 2! The day when I sold my soul to Gaben (by buying The Orange Box on a Summer Sale) can be possibly called the best day ever. This game is beautifully crafted, the enviroments look aesthetically pleasing...no wonder it's called one of the BEST games on Steam. Valve, you did a damn good job here.

Pros:
- Nice looking enviroments
- Good story
- Awesome soundtrack
- Vehicle segments are cool!

Cons:
None. Might add if I remember some.

Conclusion is...again, Valve. You did a good job with this game.
One of the best games ever made.

Still a very good FPS game with an interesting setting of a totalitarian regime controlling parts of earth. In my opinion the story is only loosely connected to the first part and doesn't make any sense as sequel to Half-Life 1. It's a whole new setting with only minor hints at the first part. You could very well play and understand it without even having a look at part 1. Which is my biggest criticism on this game. Otherwise it's a fast-paced and very entertaining FPS with diversified levels. The staging is quite impressive, even today. The story itself is rather thin and is lacking explanations on how things developed ever since the protagonist got frozen or even about part 1. Yet again, the series was never finished by the developers Valve, which is the other big criticism in this review. In general I would say Half-Life 2 was another victim of the "bigger, better, colossal" mistake in US mentality, rather than a clean connection with an elaborate continuance of the story. 

Otherwise I'm recommending it for those who like fast FPS with a entertaining setting (8 / 10 points).

Theres an issue with intel graphics and the game npcs I think. While playing Anti Citizen One chapter the  npc rebels that are in your squad ebcome invisible and eventually cause your game to crash. Make it unplayable past that point for me. Never had this issue before.

When i was younger i didn't have any clue about this game, but when i was growing up i heard more people tell me about it and how great this game is. I have been playing Garry's Mod for quite a while now, but i never fired this bad boy up. It's now years later and i finally decided to see what all the fuss was all about. This review is not from someone who grew up with Half-Life at all.

I honestly think this game is amazing. I started and finished this game not that long ago and i geniunly had a lot of fun playing it. The graphics still look pretty good! I understand now why people like it so much. So if you don't have this game yet and you're holding back on buying it, because you never even played the first game, then you really should just buy it. This game is a real classic and you should atleast try it.
One of the best pc games of all time

J'ai fait une fois toute l'histoire avant de la recommencer dans la foul√©e afin d'accomplir tous les succ√®s Steam.

An amazing, unforgettable experience, even 14 years after it's inital release. I finsihed the game a couple months ago, and found this game to be possibly the greatest singleplayer experience I have ever had. If you haven't played, you are seriously missing out.

This is a classic that every gamer should at least play through once.

This is one of the best games I've ever played in terms of gameplay and writing and it breaks my heart that Valve abandoned it. That's why Episode 3 or HL3 will never be released and that's also why the Writer of all Half Life games, Marc Laidlaw, has decided to publish the story of HL2: Episode 3.

He of course used different names like Gertie Fremont instead of Gordon Freeman because of legal issues i guess but people have already translated it into the proper names and in many languages.

http://www.marclaidlaw.com/epistle-3/  - Original
https://github.com/Jackathan/MarcLaidlaw-Epistle3/  - Translations

It's just sad to see a great game like this end with a Text Document to read instead of actually playing it.
